channel.title: Calas on Cloudian
channel.description: Recent content in Calas on Cloudian

item.title: Part 1: Foundations & “Eight Great Ideas”
item.description: Preface # The preface starts with a motivation to read this book - professionals of every computing specialty should understand both hardware and software.

item.title: Part 2: Inside the Machine – Abstraction Layers & Technologies
item.description: Below Your Program # For computers to run complex applications, there needs to be some sort of translation.

item.title: Part 3: Performance, Power & the “Sea Change”
item.description: Performance # When you are choosing a computer, how should you choose?

item.title: Part 4: Real-World Examples & Wrap-Up
item.description: Benchmarking the Intel Core i7 # SPEC CPU Benchmark # If you had 2 computers, how would you know one of them performed better than the other?

item.title: Chapter 1 - Computer Abstractions and Technology
item.description: This is the first chapter of the book. I divided my thoughts and summary into four sections:

item.title: Computer Organization and Design RISC-V edition
item.description: As part of my internship, I decided to read “Computer Organization and Design RISC-V edition” by David A.

item.title: Computer Organization
item.description: Here, I will be updating what I learned about computer organization and architecture.

item.title: Internship Timeline
item.description:
Motivation for the internship:
#

I am passionate about forging a career in research and innovation within computer engineering. This internship offers a unique opportunity to translate my theoretical knowledge into hands-on expertise by designing and building a processor from the ground up.

item.title: Learning Logs
item.description: This is where I will update my daily progress and activities.

item.title: Week 1
item.description: Week 1 Learning Log (May 19–23, 2025) # 1. Objectives # FPGA Architecture & Tools Understand FPGA internal architecture: CLBs (LUTs, muxes, flip-flops), on-chip SRAM/Block RAM Install and configure Vivado/Vitis 2022.

item.title: 555 Timers
item.description: Definition # 555 timers is the most beloved and used integrated circuits, used mainly for timing and waveform generation.

item.title: Bi-stable Flip Flop
item.description: At the heart of an SRAM cell lies a bistable flip-flop, which is a circuit capable of holding one of two stable states: logic ‘0’ or logic ‘1’.

item.title: Configuration Logic Block
item.description: The architecture of FPGAs rely heavily on Configuration Logic Blocks (CLBs).

item.title: Digital Logic Circuits
item.description: This is where I will be adding entries on theories and concepts I learned along the way and would like to look back and reference.

item.title: LUT
item.description: Definition # Look up table is a memory. Instead of recomputing a circuit or a logic function every time, we compute and store in LUTs.

item.title: SRAM
item.description: SRAMs are static memory. They are implemented using 6 transistors usually and because of that more expensive.

item.title: Week 2
item.description: Week 2 Learning Log (May 26–30, 2025) # 1. Objectives # HDL Implementation & Simulation Implement and simulate the following combinational primitives: 4-bit Subtractor (subtractor4.

item.title: Week 3
item.description: Week 3 Learning Log (June 2–6, 2025) # 1. Objectives # ALU Implementation & Testing
